discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: @anton-trunov Could you rebase this, so that PR #429 can benefit from this? Or, can we merge this now? cc: @CohenCyril

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment: I'd be very much in favor of just merging it as it is -- the change seems to be pretty trivial and `fcsl-pcm` builds in about 35-40 seconds on my machine, so it wouldn't make much impact on the build times for Mathcomp's CI.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
Hi, I do think we have a policy yet on what to integrate to mathcomp CI, I am fine with integrating fcsl-pcm to the CI, but I would like that it is discussed during the math-comp.
Also I prefer this is rebased just before merging to check that the current version of fcsl-pcm is indeed compatible with the latest dev version of mathcomp.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment:
Hi Cyril,
Oh, you just wanted to restart the CI (I was confused by the fact that there was no merge conflicts).
Done.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Oh, you just wanted to restart the CI (I was confused by the fact that there was no merge conflicts).

I wanted to restart the CI on the latest codebase (hence the need to rebase on master first).

discussion.author: pi8027
discussion.comment: Thanks anyway. Now I see PR #429 doesn't break FCSL-PCM.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment:
> I wanted to restart the CI on the latest codebase (hence the need to rebase on master first).

Indeed, that's very reasonable (I just forgot to mention that I recently tested against the latest Mathcomp version in FCSL-PCM's own CI)

> Thanks anyway. Now I see PR #429 doesn't break FCSL-PCM.

Awesome! Thank you.

review_discussion.author: ybertot
review_discussion.comment: I will soon be preparing the release for math-comp 1.10.0.  I don't expect this Pull Request to be part of this release.  Please react if my expectation is wrong.

review_discussion.author: anton-trunov
review_discussion.comment: I think this is fine. It would be great though to merge this PR before merging some other PRs that may introduce breaking changes, e.g. #429.

commits.author: anton-trunov
commits.message:
Add FCSL-PCM library to CI

FCSL-PCM is in Coq's CI, so this will prevent breaking Coq's CI, see
https://github.com/imdea-software/fcsl-pcm/issues/17
